show.title: Sing-a-Long-a The Greatest Showman
show.headline: Ladies and gents, this is the movie party you've waited for

event.title: <show-title>Sing-a-Long-a The Greatest Showman</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along</event-type-title>
event.headline: Ladies and gents, this is the movie party you've waited for
event.description:
Look out, 'cause here it comes...the smash hit musical "comes alive" like never before!

Inspired by the imagination of P.T. Barnum, THE GREATEST SHOWMAN is an original musical that celebrates the birth of show business and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.

Cheer on Hugh Jackman and wolf-whistle at Zac Efron as you experience THE GREATEST SHOWMAN in the greatest way possible...with interactive props, a themed menu, and lyrics on the screen so you can join in as loud as you want. Costumes are highly encouraged and full audience participation is essential.

eventType.title: Sing-Along
eventType.headline: Sing along to your favorite movie musicals
eventType.description: Celebrate your favorite movie musicals at our special Sing-Along screenings where we encourage the audience to join the chorus with on-screen lyrics. Vocal chops not required.

show.title: CatVideoFest 2024
show.headline: Come watch some silly cat videos for a good cause

show.title: Longlegs
show.headline: A disturbing case hits a little close to home for a rookie FBI agent

show.title: Hot Fuzz
show.headline: Edgar Wright's silly deconstruction of the buddy cop genre

event.title: <show-title>Hot Fuzz</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Big cops. Small town. Moderate violence.
event.description:
By the power of Greyskull, join us for an interactive celebration of director Edgar Wright’s balls-to-the-wall supercop comedy masterpiece, HOT FUZZ! Wright and his collaborators Simon Pegg and Nick Frost do to action cinema what they did to horror in SHAUN OF THE DEAD: They walk the cleverest of lines between homage, parody, and downright badass awesomeness. And when you model yourself after movies like POINT BREAK and BAD BOYS II, how could the results be anything but spectacular?

We’re even equipping you with everything you need to join the Sandford Police Service, including police badges, mustaches, and aviator glasses.

show.title: Grease
show.headline: Summer lovin' lives on in this quintessential movie musical celebrating the '50s

event.title: <show-title>Grease</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Warm up your pipes for a systematic, hydromatic sing-along
event.description:
We’re hopelessly devoted to GREASE, with its lovable characters, doo-wop style, and, of course, those endlessly catchy tunes. To celebrate this timeless classic, we’re putting together an interactive, prop-filled, hand-jiving Sing-Along Movie Party for all you T-Birds and Pink Ladies out there (beauty school dropouts also welcome).

We’ll kick things off with a pre-show hand jive contest before we start the interactive show, where you’ll have some candy cigarettes to help you look like a greaser, a comb so that you can comb along to the action, pom poms in Rydell High colors, and beauty caps to help you get the perfect ‘do. And because this is a Sing-Along, we’ll have the lyrics up onscreen to help every Danny, Sandy, Rizzo, and Kenickie in the audience get in on the fun.

So roll up the cuffs on those jeans, grab your respective black leather and pink satin jackets, theatrically comb your hair, and cruise on down to join us for the most rockin’ Sing-Along Movie Party ever.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW Hero 1920x1080 v3

posterImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW P 960x1400

show.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
show.headline: Darkness will descend

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Hp prisoner of azkaban sp hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: Hp prisoner of azkaban sp hero

posterImages.altText: Hp prisoner of az sp poster

event.title: <show-title>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wands up for a magical screening of Harry's time-twisting adventure
event.description:
Accio the best Harry Potter movie ever! Accio awesome themed props! Accio a theater full of awesome Potter heads! There, that should just about summon everything we need for a magical Movie Party for Alfonso Cuarón’s chillingly fun vision of Harry’s third year at Hogwarts, HARRY POTTER AND THE PRISONER OF AZKABAN.

Things get a little dark for our trio of newly teenaged wizards, with Hermione coming to the disturbing revelation that even she might not be able to handle taking every class at once. Oh, and there’s a shape-shifting prison escapee on the hunt for Harry with murderous intent. We made sure to stop by Diagon Alley for all of the school supplies you’ll need, including wind-up rats, custom tattoo sheets, Time Turner necklaces, and custom tea bags. And since we want this party to be as magical as possible, we encourage all of you witches and wizards to bring your wands to the show.

show.title: Beetlejuice
show.headline: We dare you to say his name three times

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Haunt along with the ghost with the most, babes
event.description:
Betelgeuse, Betelgeuse…BETELGEUSE! Well, we’ve summoned him, guess we might as well throw a Movie Party for him.

BEETLEJUICE is the timeless tale of a ghostly couple and the troublesome “bio-exorcist” they employ to help scare away the living inhabiting their house. It’s megawatt Michael Keaton at his kookiest, Winona Ryder, Alec Baldwin, and Geena Davis at their dreamiest, and vintage Tim Burton from start to finish.

Resurrect the undead fun with spooky props galore and all kinds of delights for the Recently Deceased. This ghoulishly interactive screening comes with Miss Argentina sashes, shrimp keychains, BEETLEJUICE stickers, and even sticky eyeballs. Btw, if you feel an uncontrollable urge to Day-o (the banana song), that’s normal.

show.title: Clue
show.headline: Seven suspects, six weapons, five bodies, and three endings

event.title: <show-title>Clue</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Mr. Boddy personally invites you to a killer party
event.description:
A mysterious invitation brings six strangers to a secluded mansion for an unconventional dinner party where each guest receives a pseudonym. As they learn more about their host, Mr. Boddy (Lee Ving, FLASHDANCE), via his butler, Wadsworth (Tim Curry, THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW), the group quickly realizes that Boddy has a devious plan in mind for all of them. And that’s when people start to die.

With a cast of comedy heavyweights including Madeline Kahn (YOUNG FRANKENSTEIN), Christopher Lloyd (BACK TO THE FUTURE), and Michael McKean (THIS IS SPINAL TAP), CLUE turns the classic, stuffy murder mystery on its head. Jam-packed with physical comedy, goofy puns, sexual innuendo, and twist upon twist upon twist, the film is a hilarious showcase for some of the best comic actors who ever lived.

And because this is a Movie Party, we’ll provide you with fun props and all sorts of blunt objects (that you didn't realize were weapons until your mom had to explain that you can actually kill anyone with basically anything) so that you can get in on all the murderous mayhem (note: please don’t murder anybody). You’ll have so much fun, you’ll feel fl-flame-flames! On the side of your face!

show.title: Footloose (1984)
show.headline: The music is on his side

event.title: <show-title>Footloose (1984)</show-title>
event.headline: The music is on his side
event.description: It’s time to lace up your Converse high tops and hit the abandoned industrial facility for some anxiety-fueled dance gymnastics because this month, Queer Film Theory 101 is cutting FOOTLOOSE. The small conservative rural community of Bomont is rocked when androgynous Chicago teen Ren McCormick (Kevin Bacon) moves to town and rejects the local ban on dancing. A town with no dancing? Jump back! That sounds an awful lot like a town with a drag ban, and that’s some bullshit. Also wouldn’t that be remarkably hard to enforce? Because I’m wiggling my hips while I’m writing this and who’s gonna stop me? Now, sometimes the queer read we posit on Queer Film Theory 101 is a stretch, but that is simply not the case when it comes to this '80s classic. From Bacon and Chris Penn’s “Let’s Hear It For The Boy” homoerotic dance lessons to the religious overtones of Reverend Shaw’s (John Lithgow) vendetta against undulating bodies, this movie is pretty damn camp. It’s not a huge leap in logic to see how “dancing” in FOOTLOOSE is a metaphor for queerness. Hell, there’s even a church “coming out” scene, and Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker are in this movie – it’s for the gays and the dolls, y’all. While FOOTLOOSE wasn’t exactly well received critically (Roger Ebert called it “a seriously confused movie that tries to do three things, and does all of them badly” and that shit sounds pretty damn queer to me) the film and its soundtrack were commercial hits and skyrocketed Bacon to stardom. See you on the dance floor, baby!

show.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
show.headline: The Ghost with the Most is back

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: There ain't no party like an afterlife party
event.description:
Movie party…movie party…movie party. Welp, guess it’s official now – we have to throw a BEETLEJUICE BEETLEJUICE Movie Party.

We’re celebrating the Ghost with the Most’s return with a super fun screening complete with themed props we plucked straight from the afterlife. Chow down on cockroaches (don’t really though, they’re not real, and also don’t eat real ones, gross), ring fingers, afterlife name tags, black and white ribbon dancers that may or may not be sandworms, and light-up gravestone keychains so you can always find your keys’ final resting place.

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Classic movie, interactive props…mass hysteria!
event.description:
For 40 years, GHOSTBUSTERS has held a special place in the hearts of moviegoers with its eye-popping special effects, iconic characters, and, of course, its cast of comedy heavyweights led by Bill Murray. So we want to show our love for this beloved blockbuster by throwing an epically spooky movie party.

We’ll have a bunch of ghostly goodies to help you get in on the fun, including some slime from Slimer himself, some Stay Puft marshmallows, and some glow necklaces you can wave around anytime the Ghostbusters use their proton packs (just don’t cross the streams).

Join us and cheer on Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston in the fight against the slimy, spooky, supernatural spirits haunting New York City in this hilarious ’80s classic.

show.title: Point Break (1991)
show.headline: Little hand says it's time to rock and roll

show.title: Batman Forever
show.headline: Courage now, truth always, Batman forever!

event.title: <show-title>Batman Forever</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Party harder than the Batsuit’s nipples
event.description:
Tommy Lee Jones famously told Jim Carrey during the making of BATMAN FOREVER, “I cannot sanction your buffoonery,” but all buffoonery is sanctioned at our campy Movie Party.

In 1995, the Bat-franchise was handed to director Joel Schumacher (THE LOST BOYS), who assembled Val Kilmer, Chris O’Donnell, Jim Carrey, Tommy Lee Jones, and Nicole Kidman for a flamboyant and altogether '90s take on the caped crusader. The soundtrack plays like a 1995 greatest hits album, with killer tracks from Seal, U2, The Offspring, and Brandy.

Join in the fun with themed props like a custom Two-Face coin, custom tube socks, and a bat-shaped sticky toy that you can use as a batarang. Be sure to arrive early and compete in the “Laundry Karate” contest, where you can high kick clothes along with Chris O’Donnell in the iconic movie scene.

eventType.title: Movie Party

show.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
show.headline: The Ghost with the Most is back

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>DEAD Talk Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get a glimpse of the actual afterlife with a real paranormal investigator
event.description:
Are ghosts real, can you talk with them, and perhaps most importantly, can they really make you sing “Banana Boat (Day-O)”? Learn all this and more at our exclusive DEAD Talk Screening (Discussing Existence After Death).

We’re saying a real paranormal investigator’s name three times (we can’t tell you their name because then you’d tell your friends, they would call them up on the horn all the time, and that would make their life a hell) and summoning them to our theater for a live ghost hunting showcase. They’ll explain how modern ghost hunting works, demonstrate some of their tech, and maybe even commune with a ghost or two, assuming the spirits aren’t busy haunting Catherine O'Hara’s house. We’ll be sure to leave the equipment running in case any spirits join us for the movie.

So leave your disbelief at the door, open yourself to the other side, and join us for an evening of spooky fun, both on and off the screen.

event.title: <event-type-title>Advance Screening:</event-type-title> <show-title>Blink Twice</show-title>
event.headline: Blink twice if you want to see BLINK TWICE before anyone else
event.description: We’re not eccentric billionaires but we want to invite you to our exclusive Advance Screening of BLINK TWICE at our eccentric cinema. Get an early look at Zoë Kravitz’s thriller starring Channing Tatum and we’ll make sure you don’t mysteriously disappear. Tickets are limited, so book your seats ASAP.

show.title: Zombie
show.headline: The dead are among us

event.title: <show-title>Zombie</show-title>
event.headline: The dead are among us
event.description: ZOMBIE isn’t a movie – it’s a rite of passage. Exploding from a psychological demon-void and onto a sun-drenched beach in Dimension X, this is Lucio Fulci’s valentine to minimalism, mood, and gratuitous throat-ripping. An outbreak of zombies in New York City brings Tisa “Sister of Mia” Farrow to a tropical island, where her mad scientist father works feverishly to find a cure for the zombie rampage. But everyone knows that tropical islands in Italian horror movies can only lead to one thing. And it’s not hugs. An exercise in both beautiful design and brutal nihilism, ZOMBIE appropriated George Romero’s undead mythos and transformed it into a cultural game-changer for the horror genre. P.S. Beware of sharks.

show.title: The Brood
show.headline: The ultimate experience in inner terror!

event.title: <show-title>The Brood</show-title>
event.headline: They're her children…the children of her rage
event.description:
"THE BROOD is my version of KRAMER VS. KRAMER, but more realistic." – David Cronenberg

It’s spooky season, and that means it’s psychotherapy time…or rather “psychoplasmics” time at Queer Film Theory 101! We’re headed out for a little self-reflection at The Somafree Institute of Psychoplasmatics in David Cronenberg’s most personal and serious film THE BROOD from 1979. It’s MARRIAGE STORY on mescaline! Developed in the wake of Cronenberg’s difficult divorce, THE BROOD is a startling interrogation into cycles of abuse, patriarchy, and the destruction of the nuclear family, complete with tiny murder goblins! Gorgeous Diva Nola Carveth (the iconic Samantha Eggar) is an unstable and traumatized woman undergoing intense and experimental therapy with Dr. Hal Raglan (Oliver Reed giving stunt daddy realness) at his private institute. As a custody battle between Nola and her ineffectual milquetoast ex-husband Frank (Art Hindle) intensifies, strange murders begin to occur, revealing a terrifying and bizarre manifestation of trauma and rage. Toxic gender roles, parental failure, and pedophobia (fear of children) are all present in THE BROOD, a movie that posits “maybe heterosexuality is bad?” This gorgeous and provocative melodrama was released to both praise and claims of virulent misogyny and gynophobia, leaving its legacy complicated, but we never shy away from complications here at QFT101! No spoilers, but we’re on the woman’s side. Justice for Nola. These men done did her dirty. Come hang out with us for a night of processing and body horror – if you still want to get married and have kids after watching this movie, that is wild.

show.title: The Warriors
show.headline: Come out and play-ay-ay-ayyy...

event.title: <show-title>The Warriors</show-title>
event.headline: “These are the armies of the night”
event.description: WARRIORS…come out and GAAAY! That’s right, we’re back on our Walter Hill shit with 1979’s THE WARRIORS, the most important film ever made about New York fashionista street gangs! Cyrus, mother of the house of Gramercy Riffs, the most powerful gang in New York, summons delegates from each of the city's crews to Cortlandt Park for a summit to discuss their collective power over the NYPD. BUT oh no – Cyrus is shot and the blame is pinned on the leather-vested Coney Island gang The Warriors. Will these hunky anti-heroes manage to make it from The Bronx back to Coney Island, or will they fall to swift and color-coordinated gang justice on their journey? Developed from Sol Yurick’s significantly more complicated novel of the same name, THE WARRIORS is a queer, stylish, and entertaining romp through a bygone era of New York’s underground. I mean, it’s all based on Xenophon's Anabasis and it doesn’t get much gayer than ancient Greece. Don’t even get me started on the lesbian-coded all-girl gang called “The Lizzies,” because then we’ll be here all night. And wait, who is that mysterious DJ who appears from time to time in the film to provide narrative updates and needle drops? That’s Lynne Thigpen from Where In The World Is Carmen Sandiego? The one and only. A queer icon! If you’ve never had a chance to watch THE WARRIORS on the big screen, now’s your chance to seize the night! Don’t miss your chance to see the film that answered the question, “Wait, what if the Villiage People were a street gang?”

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
